means: [人名] [康沃尔人姓氏] 布莱特 Bligh的变体

word_mean: 枯萎病：植物的任何一种真菌病

sentence.Network_en: Manchester still suffers from urban blight and unacceptable poverty.
sentence.Network_cn: 曼彻斯特仍然受到城区脏乱和严重贫困问题的困扰。

sentence.Network_en: This discriminatory policy has really been a blight on America.

sentence.Network_en: The apple crop was wiped out by blight.
sentence.Network_cn: 枯萎病使苹果全无收成.

GRE词汇精选（五）|GRE词汇 ... blemish v. 损害；玷污；瑕疵，缺点 blight n. 植物枯萎病；v.使...枯萎 blighted adj. 枯萎的；衰老的.

list.abs: Wageningen大学的一个研究组在7月的Genome Research杂志上报道说，他们已经确定出一种导致马铃薯疫病（potato blight）的病原体的独特基因指纹。一些病原体株具有一个特殊基因的多个拷贝，而另外一些病原体株则只有一个拷贝。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 计划枯萎症（资产因实际或谣传发展计划而价值受损）

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting inflammation of the skin): of unknown origin

entry.def: You can refer to something as a blight when it causes great difficulties, and damages or spoils other things.

example.ex: This discriminatory policy has really been a blight on America...
example.tran: 这项歧视性政策确实成了美国的一大祸根。

example.ex: Manchester still suffers from urban blight and unacceptable poverty.
example.tran: 曼彻斯特仍然受到城区脏乱和严重贫困问题的困扰。

entry.tran: 破坏（生活）；使（希望）破灭；摧毁；损毁
entry.def: If something blights your life or your hopes, it damages and spoils them. If something blights an area, it spoils it and makes it unattractive.

example.ex: An embarrassing blunder nearly blighted his career before it got off the ground.
example.tran: 一个令人难堪的疏忽几乎毁掉了他还没有起步的事业。

example.ex: ...thousands of families whose lives were blighted by unemployment.
example.tran: 成千上万因为失业而难以维持生计的家庭

entry.def: Blight is a disease which makes plants dry up and die.

means.word_mean: 1. a state or condition being blighted
2. any plant disease resulting in withering without rotting

sentences.sentence: "Too much rain may blight the garden with mold"

auth_sentence.content: Excess facial hair can blight the lives of sufferers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Excess facial hair can blight the lives of sufferers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Excess facial hair can blight the lives of sufferers.

auth_sentence.content: The rabbits were as much of a blight as ever.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rabbits were as much of a blight as ever.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rabbits were as much of a blight as ever.

auth_sentence.content: But what will the neighbors say about the visual blight?
auth_sentence.res_content: But what will the neighbors say about the visual blight?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But what will the neighbors say about the visual blight?

sentences.en: The apple crop was wiped out by blight.
sentences.cn: 枯萎病使苹果全无收成。

means.word_mean: (对局势、生活或环境）有害的事物，不利因素（~ on sb/sth)

sentences.en: There is a blight on all his efforts.
sentences.cn: 他的一切努力都遭到挫折。

sentences.en: The frost has blighted my crops.
sentences.cn: 霜冻使我的庄稼枯萎了。
